column2: Do a visual check to make sure there are no observable assembly problem. refer to Schematic 0378290-000_AC.pdf and incorporated Wirelist if needed.
The AC PDU show have already been check the wiring continuity. Complte this check of no alerady done.Refer to Schematic 0378290-000_AC.pdf and incorporated Wirelist if needed.
Attach the Power Cord from AC PDU rear panel position J1 to an appropriate receptacle. The voltage source must be 208Vac. 3-Phase W/Neutral and Ground(5-wire wye configuration).

Toggle all  â€œSERV MODEâ€,â€œSTAGE OVERDâ€ and  â€œDC PWR STATâ€ to switch OFF.

Turn on the â€œSERVICE MODEâ€ (in AC PDU PLC test code, rev 2) â€œDC PWR STATâ€ (in AC PDU PLC test code, rev 1) switch on, set switch DIâ€1 to the rear position (on), the large K6 relay should come on (DOâ€1). Turn CB6 :ON.

Turn off all circuit breakers.

Disconnect P15 of the test fixture from J15 of the AC PDU and connect it to the 8900i test cable (0501295-000). Connect P18 and P19 of the test cable to connectors J18 and J19 on the AC PDU. Connect the P13 jumper connector XXXXXX-XXX to J13 on the PDU. (This jumper has an additional wire between pins 4 and 8, it can be used for all testing).
Set all test fixture motherboard switches to the front (off) position. Set all daughter board switches to the down position.

Verify that the dials on K12 (the large green relay near the front of the PDU) are set properly.
 Max = 40, Min = 20 and Delay = 0.
Switch on CB1 and CB2.
Press the front panel â€œSystem Startâ€ button to turn on the AC PDU and verify that the DO-8 LED (24VDC power) on the test fixture and the U LED on K12 are on. Verify DO-13 is off.
Switch on DI-3 and the front panel LED â€œClusterâ€ and the DO-13 LED should be on.
Switch off DI-3 and the PDU should shutdown. Switch DI-3 on again and the PDU should come back on with the â€œClusterâ€ LED on.
Switch on DI-2 and verify that LEDâ€™s DO-9, DO-10 and DO-11 are on (K12 coil).
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-9.
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-10
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-11
The Unit verify LED at K12 coil.
Switch on DI-1 and verify that LED DO-12 is on (K12 contact).
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-12
The Unit verify LED at K12 coil.
Switch off DI-2 and verify 4 LEDâ€™s go off. DO-9, DO-10, DO-11 and DO-12.
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-9.
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-10
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-11
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-12
Switch on DI-4 and verify that LED DO-14 is on (Restart I/O).
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-14
Turn off CB1 and CB2.

Insert the SD memory card with the standard AC PDU program on it into the CPU module (as of Apr 2012 the current version is 1.14). The SD card slot is under the cover with the SIMATIC label on it. Turn on CB1, CB2 and press the â€œSystem Start â€œ button. The RUN/STOP, ERROR and MAINT will flash for about 30 sec. Wait until only the MAINT light flashes then turn off CB2 and remove the memory card.
Turn on CB1 and CB2 and verify that the PLC CPU and Module RUN/STOP lights are green after 30 seconds.

Set all fixture Motherboard switches toward the front (off position). Set all Daughter Board switches in the full down position (off position). Ensure all other front panel circuit breakers OFF. (Except CB1 and CB2).
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J4 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB3, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB3 after check.
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J7 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB4, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB4 after check.
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J10 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB7, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB7 after check
With a DVM, check the voltage between DC output at the front panel
5Vdc

Turn off all circuit breakers on the front panel of the AC PDU.
